typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ClinicalSectionCandidate
typeDescription.description: Candidates of clinical sections.

featureDescription.name: headline
featureDescription.description: Headline of actual clinical section candidate.

featureDescription.name: content
featureDescription.description: Content of actual clinical section candidate.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ClinicalSectionCandidateWithoutHeadline
typeDescription.description: Candidates of clinical sections without headline.

featureDescription.name: concept
featureDescription.description: Non headline concept indicating actual section.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ClinicalSectionHeadline
typeDescription.description: Clinical section headline.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ClinicalSectionContent
typeDescription.description: Clinical section content.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ClinicalSectionKeywordConcept
typeDescription.description: Concept type for clinical section keywords.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ClinicalSection
typeDescription.description: Section type for clinical sections.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AnamnesisSection
typeDescription.description: History general describes all aspects of medical history of the patient even if not pertinent to the current procedure, and may include chief complaint, past medical history, social history, family history, surgical or procedure history, medication history, and other history information. The history may be limited to information pertinent to the current procedure or may be more comprehensive. It may also be reported as a collection of random clinical statements or it may be reported categorically. Categorical report formats may be divided into multiple subsections, including Past Medical History and Social History.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.FamilyAnamnesisSection
typeDescription.description: History of family member diseases is a report of health information, including medical, genetic, environmental, and lifestyle factors, pertaining to the patient and his or her genetic relatives (living or deceased). The family history information is used to determine possible or relevant health risk factors that may have a potential impact on the patient's healthcare risk profile.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.SocialAnamnesisSection
typeDescription.description: The Social history section contains data defining the patient's occupational, personal (e.g. lifestyle), social, and environmental history and health risk factors, as well as administrative data such as marital status, race, ethnicity and religious affiliation.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.FunctionalStatusSection
typeDescription.description: Functional status assessment describes the patient's status of normal functioning at the time a care record was created. Functional statuses include information regarding the patient relative to ambulatory ability, mental status or competency, activities of daily living (ADLs) (i.e. bathing, dressing, feeding, grooming), home/living situation having an effect on the health status of the patient, ability to care for self, social activity (i.e. issues with social cognition, participation with friends and acquaintances other than family members), occupation activity (i.e. activities partly or directly related to working), housework or volunteering, family and home responsibilities or activities related to home and family, communication ability (i.e. issues with speech, writing or cognition required for communication), and perception, including sight, hearing, taste, skin sensation, kinesthetic sense, proprioception, or balance.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TherapySection
typeDescription.description: This term was originally created for, though not limited in use to, the HL7 Implementation Guide for CDA: Progress Note. The Interventions section contains information about the specific interventions provided during the healthcare visit. Depending on the type of intervention(s) provided (procedural, education, application of assistive equipment, etc.), the details will vary but may include specification of frequency, intensity, and duration.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TreatmentRecommendationSection
typeDescription.description: Plan of care notes (previously defined as "Plan of treatment") contains data that defines pending orders, interventions, encounters, services, and procedures for the patient. The plan includes prospective, unfulfilled, or incomplete orders and requests only. The plan may also contain information about ongoing care of the patient and information regarding goals and clinical reminders.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ConditioningTreatmentSection
typeDescription.description: Myeloablative conditioning treatment such as irradiation therapy or chemotherapy.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.MedicationSection
typeDescription.description: Medications administered defines medications and fluids administered during the procedure, excluding anesthetic medications. Medications administered for anesthesia are typically documented in the section on Anesthesia.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.MedicationHistorySection
typeDescription.description: History of medication use defines a patient's current medications and history of pertinent medications. This term may also include a patient's prescription and dispense history.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AdmissionMedicationSection
typeDescription.description: Admission can refer to hospital admission, long-term care admission, or home health admission.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.DischargeMedicationSection
typeDescription.description: Hospital discharge medications defines the medications that the patient is intended to take (or stop) after discharge. This may also include a patient's prescription history and indicate the source of the medication list, for example, from a pharmacy system versus from the patient.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.MedicationRecommendationSection
typeDescription.description: Recommendation for medication after discharge.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.DiagnosisSection
typeDescription.description: History of present illness describes the history related to the reason for a given procedure. It contains the historical details leading up to and pertaining to the patient's current complaint or reason for seeking medical care. Because history of present illness can include past surgical history and other procedures, the Procedure History section may be included under the History of Present Illness section or it may stand alone as its own section.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.MainDiagnosisSection
typeDescription.description: Chief complaint records the patient's primary complaint (the patient's own description).

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.DiagnosisHistorySection
typeDescription.description: History of past illness describes the history related to their current complaints, problems, or diagnoses.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AdmissionDiagnosisSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about diagnosis on admission.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AdmissionReasonSection
typeDescription.description: This section records the patient's reason for their visit (the provider's description of the reason for visit). Local policy determines whether the information is divided into two sections or recorded in one section serving both purposes.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.DischargeDiagnosisSection
typeDescription.description: Hospital discharge diagnosis describes the patient's relevant problems or diagnoses that occurred during the hospitalization or that need to be followed after hospitalization.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AdverseEventSection
typeDescription.description: Contains a list and description of any allergies or adverse reactions pertinent to current or past medical history. At a minimum this section should contain currently active and any relevant historical allergies and adverse reactions.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ObservationSection
typeDescription.description: The Procedure findings section records clinically significant observations confirmed or discovered during a procedure, treatment or service.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.LaboratorySection
typeDescription.description: Section containing laboratory information.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.VitalSignSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about vital signs.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.SonographySection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about sonography.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.EchocardiographySection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about echocardiography.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ECGSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about ECG.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AngiogramSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about angiogram.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.OphthalmologySection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about ophthalmology.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.VisualAcuitySection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about the visual acuity.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TensioSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about the tensio.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AnteriorEyeSegmentSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about the anterior eye segment.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.OcularFundusSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about the ocular fundus.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.OpticalCoherenceTomographySection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about the optical coherence tomography.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.FunctionalAngiographySection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about the functional angiography.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.FindingSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing information about findings.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.DischargeFindingSection
typeDescription.description: Hospital discharge physical findings records a narrative description of the patient's physical findings.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.GeneralConditionSection
typeDescription.description: Physical findings (of general status) describes general observations and readily observable attributes of the patient, including affect and demeanor, apparent age compared to actual age, gender, ethnicity, nutritional status based on appearance, body build and habitus (e.g., muscular, cachectic, obese), developmental or other deformities, gait and mobility, personal hygiene, evidence of distress, and voice quality and speech.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.SpecimenSection
typeDescription.description: The Procedure specimens taken section records the tissues, objects, or samples taken from the patient during the procedure including biopsies, aspiration fluid, or other samples sent for pathological analysis. The narrative may include a description of the specimens.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.SymptomSection
typeDescription.description: The Review of systems section contains a relevant collection of symptoms and functions systematically gathered by a clinician. It includes symptoms the patient is currently experiencing, some of which were not elicited during the history of present illness, as well as a potentially large number of pertinent negatives, for example, symptoms that the patient denied experiencing.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ProcedureSection
typeDescription.description: Procedure records the descriptions of the procedure with an extensive narrative and may include procedure site preparation, pertinent details related to measurements and markings, procedure times, instrumentation, and vital signs and other monitoring data.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.ProcedureHistorySection
typeDescription.description: This section defines all interventional, surgical, diagnostic, or therapeutic procedures or treatments pertinent to the patient historically and at the time the document is generated.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.EpicrisisSection
typeDescription.description: An evaluation (also called asessment, impression or diagnoses) note represents the clinician's conclusions and working assumptions that will guide treatment of the patient. The assessment formulates a specific plan or set of recommendations. The assessment may be a list of specific disease entities or a narrative block.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.MiscClinicalSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing other information.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.DocumentFooterSection
typeDescription.description: Section containing document footer.
